intro: Tiquilia elongata, commonly known as the longstalked tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Tiquilia elongata is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in spring and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
